originContent: # Chocolatey-for-wine
translatedContent: # Chocolatey-for-wine

originContent: Chocolatey packagemanager automatic installer in wine, handy to install quickly programs in wine (and subsequently find bugs in wine ;) )
translatedContent: Chocolatey package manager automatic installer in wine, handy to quickly install programs in wine (and subsequently find bugs in wine ;) )

originContent: For some bugs workarounds are added like for Visual Studio Community 2022 and nodejs, see further on.
translatedContent: For some bugs workarounds are added like for Visual Studio Community 2022 and nodejs, see further on.

originContent: As I was bored during lock-down I wrote a custom winetricks(.ps1) with verbs I find handy. Just do 'winetricks' to see them.
translatedContent: As I was bored during lock-down I wrote a custom winetricks(.ps1) with verbs I find handy. Just do 'winetricks' to see them.

originContent: For some verbs a full restart of wine is needed (due to recent wine changes). You'll see a messagebox and the session will be ended. Just start powershell again and retry the verb. If this is done once, it won't be needed anymore for any verb.
translatedContent: For some verbs a full restart of wine is needed (due to recent wine changes). You'll see a messagebox and the session will be ended. Just start powershell again and retry the verb. If this is done once, it won't be needed anymore for any verb.

originContent: Example:
translatedContent: Example:

originContent: 'winetricks vs22_interactiveinstaller'  ( --> session will be ended)
translatedContent: 'winetricks vs22_interactiveinstaller'  ( --> session will be ended)

originContent: do 'wine powershell'
translatedContent: do 'wine powershell'

originContent: do 'winetricks vs22_interactiveinstaller'
translatedContent: do 'winetricks vs22_interactiveinstaller'

originContent: (BTW via 'winetricks vs22_interactive_installer' you can install select what to install via the Visual Studio 2022 installer; 'winetricks vs22_interactive_installer' now got me in ten minutes into the main program (selected Desktop development with C++)).
translatedContent: (BTW via 'winetricks vs22_interactive_installer' you can install select what to install via the Visual Studio 2022 installer; 'winetricks vs22_interactive_installer' now got me in ten minutes into the main program (selected Desktop development with C++)).

originContent: Install :
translatedContent: Install :

originContent: - Download and unzip the release zip-file and do 'wine ChoCinstaller_0.5c.751.exe' (takes about a minute to complete)
translatedContent: - Download and unzip the release zip-file and do 'wine ChoCinstaller_0.5c.751.exe' (takes about a minute to complete)

originContent: Optional:
translatedContent: Optional:

originContent: - Run the installer like 'wine ChoCinstaller_0.5a.751.exe /s' , then the install files (like Powershell*.msi and dotnet48) are saved in
translatedContent: - Run the installer like 'wine ChoCinstaller_0.5a.751.exe /s' , then the install files (like Powershell*.msi and dotnet48) are saved in

originContent: MyDocuments and they don't need to be downloaded again if you create a new prefix)
translatedContent: MyDocuments and they don't need to be downloaded again if you create a new prefix)

originContent: Optional:
translatedContent: Optional:

originContent: - Run the installer like 'wine ChoCinstaller_0.5a.751.exe /q' to prevent the automatic launch of the powershell window (so install only).
translatedContent: - Run the installer like 'wine ChoCinstaller_0.5a.751.exe /q' to prevent the automatic launch of the powershell window (so install only).

originContent: Optional:
translatedContent: Optional:

originContent: - Check if things went well: "choco install chromium" and  "start chrome.exe (--no-sandbox not needed anymore as of wine-8,4)"
translatedContent: - Check if things went well: "choco install chromium" and  "start chrome.exe (--no-sandbox not needed anymore as of wine-8,4)"

originContent: ![Screenshot from 2022-08-26 12-31-18](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26839562/186885380-d5a617c4-9cf4-4831-a475-2bd85a3b5784.png)
translatedContent: ![Screenshot from 2022-08-26 12-31-18](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26839562/186885380-d5a617c4-9cf4-4831-a475-2bd85a3b5784.png)

originContent: About PowerShell:
translatedContent: About PowerShell:

originContent: Tip: Chocolatey usually installs the latest version of a program, which might reveal new wine bugs. You might have more luck with an older version of the software.
translatedContent: Tip: Chocolatey usually installs the latest version of a program, which might reveal new wine bugs. You might have more luck with an older version of the software.

originContent: Example:
translatedContent: Example:

originContent: choco search --exact microsoft-edge --all (--> list all versions)
translatedContent: choco search --exact microsoft-edge --all (--> list all versions)

originContent: choco install microsoft-edge --version --version='135.0.3179.98'
translatedContent: choco install microsoft-edge --version --version='135.0.3179.98'

originContent: General info:
translatedContent: General info:

originContent: - 'wine powershell.exe' starts the PowerShell-Core console.
translatedContent: - 'wine powershell.exe' starts the PowerShell-Core console.

originContent: About ConEmu:
translatedContent: About ConEmu:

originContent: ConEmu console suffers from a few wine-bugs:
translatedContent: ConEmu console suffers from a few wine-bugs:

originContent: - Ctrl^C to quit a program that doesn't return to the console doesn`t work. Use Shift^Ctrl^C instead.
translatedContent: - Ctrl^C to quit a program that doesn't return to the console doesn`t work. Use Shift^Ctrl^C instead.

originContent: - Selecting text in the ConEmu window (for copy/paste) doesn't highlight the selection. Included is a very sad hack       against recent wine versions that works around this, so highlighting should just work now.
translatedContent: - Selecting text in the ConEmu window (for copy/paste) doesn't highlight the selection. Included is a very sad hack       against recent wine versions that works around this, so highlighting should just work now.

originContent: About winetricks(.ps1):
translatedContent: About winetricks(.ps1):

originContent: - If you don't call it ('winetricks' in powershell-console) , nothing gets downloaded so no overhead there.
translatedContent: - If you don't call it ('winetricks' in powershell-console) , nothing gets downloaded so no overhead there.

originContent: - A lot of verbs (like powershell 5.1) need a few essential files to extract stuff from msu packages. Installing these essential files requires first huge downloads , and  takes lots of time during 1st time usage. But after things are cached it goes quickly . For example if you might wanna try 'winetricks ps51' first, it will take about  approx. 15 minutes. Some other verbs might take 5 minutes on first time usage. But after you called a verb once this nuisance is gone.
translatedContent: - A lot of verbs (like powershell 5.1) need a few essential files to extract stuff from msu packages. Installing these essential files requires first huge downloads , and  takes lots of time during 1st time usage. But after things are cached it goes quickly . For example if you might wanna try 'winetricks ps51' first, it will take about  approx. 15 minutes. Some other verbs might take 5 minutes on first time usage. But after you called a verb once this nuisance is gone.

originContent: - Files are cached in directory MyDocuments. If you call all verbs it'll take about 800 MB there.
translatedContent: - Files are cached in directory MyDocuments. If you call all verbs it'll take about 800 MB there.

originContent: - Hopefully some better 64-bit support for various verbs.
translatedContent: - Hopefully some better 64-bit support for various verbs.

originContent: - Possibility to extract a file and (try) install from an msu file. Do 'winetricks install_dll_from_msu' to see how.
translatedContent: - Possibility to extract a file and (try) install from an msu file. Do 'winetricks install_dll_from_msu' to see how.

originContent: - A rudimentary Powershell 5.1.
translatedContent: - A rudimentary Powershell 5.1.

originContent: - experimental dotnet481 installation, and dotnet35 (might be needed by apps not satisfied with current dotnet48 installation).
translatedContent: - experimental dotnet481 installation, and dotnet35 (might be needed by apps not satisfied with current dotnet48 installation).

originContent: - Autotab-completion. Note: while using multiple verbs from command line they have to be seperated by a comma
translatedContent: - Autotab-completion. Note: while using multiple verbs from command line they have to be seperated by a comma

originContent: from now on (this is how powershell handles multiple arguments)
translatedContent: from now on (this is how powershell handles multiple arguments)

originContent: So 'winetricks riched20 gdiplus' won't work anymore, use 'winetricks riched20,gdiplus' instead
translatedContent: So 'winetricks riched20 gdiplus' won't work anymore, use 'winetricks riched20,gdiplus' instead

originContent: - Some programs fail to install/run when you try them via Chocolatey due to wine-bugs. I added a few workarounds in winetricks for them, see below.
translatedContent: - Some programs fail to install/run when you try them via Chocolatey due to wine-bugs. I added a few workarounds in winetricks for them, see below.

originContent: - Special verbs (winetricks vs19, vs22 and vs22_interactive_installer) to install working Visual Studio Community 2019 and 2022 (see screenshot, >10 mins to install and requires approx. 10GB!, after install start devenv.exe from directory c:\Program\ Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\Common7\IDE/)
translatedContent: - Special verbs (winetricks vs19, vs22 and vs22_interactive_installer) to install working Visual Studio Community 2019 and 2022 (see screenshot, >10 mins to install and requires approx. 10GB!, after install start devenv.exe from directory c:\Program\ Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\Common7\IDE/)

originContent: ![screenshot](https://github.com/PietJankbal/Chocolatey-for-wine/assets/26839562/d576a619-c752-4eb1-81c2-6f6b66b50ff6)
translatedContent: ![screenshot](https://github.com/PietJankbal/Chocolatey-for-wine/assets/26839562/d576a619-c752-4eb1-81c2-6f6b66b50ff6)

originContent: - Special verb to get access to various unix commands like grep,sed, file, less, curl etc. etc. (winetricks git.portable, Disclaimer: some commands do not yet work due to wine bugs
translatedContent: - Special verb to get access to various unix commands like grep,sed, file, less, curl etc. etc. (winetricks git.portable, Disclaimer: some commands do not yet work due to wine bugs

originContent: - Also included a few powershell scripts adapted from codesnippets found on the internet:
translatedContent: - Also included a few powershell scripts adapted from codesnippets found on the internet:

originContent: - How to embed an exe in a powershell script via Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection (the exe won't show up in tasklist).
translatedContent: - How to embed an exe in a powershell script via Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection (the exe won't show up in tasklist).

originContent: - How to make fancy messageboxes
translatedContent: - How to make fancy messageboxes

originContent: - Convert a powershell script (ps1) into an exe.
translatedContent: - Convert a powershell script (ps1) into an exe.

originContent: - And a few other
translatedContent: - And a few other

originContent: About system programs:
translatedContent: About system programs:

originContent: Feature is added to replace simple system programs like for example setx.exe by a function in
translatedContent: Feature is added to replace simple system programs like for example setx.exe by a function in

originContent: c:\\Program Files\Powershell\7\profile.ps1. Or add system programs that are missing like getmac.exe.
translatedContent: c:\\Program Files\Powershell\7\profile.ps1. Or add system programs that are missing like getmac.exe.

originContent: If programs fail because of insufficient mature or missing system programs one could write a
translatedContent: If programs fail because of insufficient mature or missing system programs one could write a

originContent: function to return whatever the program expects.
translatedContent: function to return whatever the program expects.

originContent: Like in profile.ps1 I added (amongst others) a wmic.exe that supports a bit more options,
translatedContent: Like in profile.ps1 I added (amongst others) a wmic.exe that supports a bit more options,

originContent: and a basic setx.exe.
translatedContent: and a basic setx.exe.

originContent: Or you could just manipulate the arguments passed to the system program. See profile.ps1 and choc_install.ps1.
translatedContent: Or you could just manipulate the arguments passed to the system program. See profile.ps1 and choc_install.ps1.

originContent: No garantuee this works for more complex programs as well...
translatedContent: No guarantee this works for more complex programs as well...

originContent: Notes:
translatedContent: Notes:

originContent: - Do NOT use on existing wineprefix, only on fresh new created prefix! The installer just stupidly installs dotnet48 itsself and messes with registrykeys.
translatedContent: - Do NOT use on existing wineprefix, only on fresh new created prefix! The installer just stupidly installs dotnet48 itself and messes with registry keys.

originContent: If you have any dotnet version already installed with regular winetricks.sh, it will likely fail, and even if it succeeds, you'll likely end up with a broken prefix.
translatedContent: If you have any dotnet version already installed with regular winetricks.sh, it will likely fail, and even if it succeeds, you'll likely end up with a broken prefix.

originContent: If you need to install stuff with regular winetricks.sh for programs, do NOT use any of the dotnet* verbs.
translatedContent: If you need to install stuff with regular winetricks.sh for programs, do NOT use any of the dotnet* verbs.

originContent: BTW 'Arial' and 'd3dcompiler_47' verbs are already installed by default.
translatedContent: BTW 'Arial' and 'd3dcompiler_47' verbs are already installed by default.

originContent: - WINEARCH=win32 is _not_ supported!
translatedContent: - WINEARCH=win32 is _not_ supported!

originContent: - Updating from a previous version is for now not (yet) supported, maybe later
translatedContent: - Updating from a previous version is for now not (yet) supported, maybe later

originContent: Compile:
translatedContent: Compile:

originContent: - If you want to compile yourself instead of downloading binaries: see compilation instructions in mainv1.c and installer.c
translatedContent: - If you want to compile yourself instead of downloading binaries: see compilation instructions in mainv1.c and installer.c

originContent: - Then copy choc_install.ps1 into the same directory
translatedContent: - Then copy choc_install.ps1 into the same directory

originContent: - Then do 'wine ChoCinstaller_0.5a.735.exe'
translatedContent: - Then do 'wine ChoCinstaller_0.5a.735.exe'
